channel.title: What program do I code in?
channel.description: I have decided to choose Python as my 'Beginner Language.' So I would like to know which Programs, that I can code in that language. Not programs I can code.

item.title: What program do I code in?
item.dc:creator: @MoparDeadly MoparDeadly
item.description:
@MoparDeadly wrote:

Thanks for helping guys

Read full topic
item.source: What program do I code in?

item.title: What program do I code in?
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:18, topic:432635”][quote author=t4 link=topic=535345.msg3918769#msg3918769 date=1329495458]

I have decided to choose Python as my ‘Beginner Language.’
So I would like to know which Programs, that I can code in that language.
Not programs I can code.
[/quote]python mainly resides in webscripts.

no.

You can use Geany, vim, Eclipse w/ PyDev plugin, etc.

pydev plugin didnt install correctly, i cant find a download for geany for windows, and same with vim.

http://www.vim.org/download.php#pc

where did all the intuition go…

i think the big blocks of informative text scare away many of the youngsters

basically… im a VERY BUSY MAN I CANT WASTE MY TIME READING PARAGRAPHS. na im just lazy, just like more than half of the U.S. population[/quote]fair enough

Read full topic

item.title: What program do I code in?
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:2, topic:432635”][quote author=MoparDeadly link=topic=535345.msg3913914#msg3913914 date=1329001447]
I have decided to choose Python as my ‘Beginner Language.’
So I would like to know which Programs, that I can code in that language.
Not programs I can code.
[/quote]python mainly resides in webscripts.[/quote]come back when you know what you’re talking about

[quote=“t4, post:7, topic:432635”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=535345.msg3914897#msg3914897 date=1329074650]

Python comes with it’s own IDE - IDLE.

it’s shit, though

I just use notepad++ for python
[/quote]
isn’t a cross-platform solution, though ;)[/quote]who cares he didn’t ask for cross platform

Read full topic
